newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Luxembourg says jobs summit in October possible.
newsitem.headline: Luxembourg says jobs summit in October possible.

text.p: The Luxembourg presidency of the European Union may call a special summit meeting in October to address the region's high unemployment, a spokesman for the Luxembourg delegation said on Sunday.
"Several countries have approached us and we would be willing," Guy Schuller, spokesman for Luxembourg Prime Minister Jean-Claude Juncker, said in answer to Reuter enquiries.
The possibility of a jobs summit was immediately confirmed by Juncker himself.

"Some countries have come with the idea of this. It seems to be excellent under the condition that we know clearly what we want," Juencker told French daily Le Figaro in an interview to be published in Monday's edition.

French demands to put the plight of Europe's 18 million joblessness high on the agenda for the June 16-17 Amsterdam summit of EU leaders has turned the meeting into one of the most contentious the EU has seen.

A jobs summit was being seen by officials on the sidelines of the meeting as one possible way to acknowledge the demands of the new French left-wing government without making immediate promises to commit funds to job creation programmes.
